name: Lillian CULP and Robert Culp, H/W, Appellants, v. Claude M. WILLIAMS, M.D.

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, JJ.
McDERMOTT, J., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
ZAPPALA and CAPPY, JJ., dissent and would reach the merits of the case.
parties: Lillian CULP and Robert Culp, H/W, Appellants, v. Claude M. WILLIAMS, M.D.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
McDERMOTT, J., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
ZAPPALA and CAPPY, JJ., dissent and would reach the merits of the case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Harry A. Dorian, Jr., Philadelphia, for appellants.
William V. Coleman, Philadelphia, for appellee.
Kevin P. Foley, Terrence R. Nealon, Scranton, for amicus curiae Pa. Trial Lawyers Ass’n.
casebody.head_matter:
582 A.2d 319
Lillian CULP and Robert Culp, H/W, Appellants, v. Claude M. WILLIAMS, M.D.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Oct. 23, 1990.
Decided Nov. 9, 1990.
Harry A. Dorian, Jr., Philadelphia, for appellants.
William V. Coleman, Philadelphia, for appellee.
Kevin P. Foley, Terrence R. Nealon, Scranton, for amicus curiae Pa. Trial Lawyers Ass’n.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, JJ.
